alert.note: Alert for Washington (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 4:25AM EST until January 12 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts...Rhode Island... Farmington River At Unionville affecting Hartford County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Kent and Providence Counties. Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting New London and Washington Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sudbury River...including Saxonville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Major flooding is forecast. For the Pawcatuck River...including Wood River Junction, Westerly... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pawcatuck River at Westerly. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Floodwaters approach lowest lying homes along Hiscox Road in Westerly. Along Route 3, flooding occurs at some homes in French Village in Hopkinton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EST Wednesday was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage due to tidal effects with a maximum value of 7.6 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM EST.
